item.title: WHO reports cholera surge in Yemen: 250,000 suspected infections and 861 deaths as of Dec 1 - WION
item.description:
WHO reports cholera surge in Yemen: 250,000 suspected infections and 861 deaths as of Dec 1

Date: December 1, 2024 | Source: WHO

The outbreak of cholera in Yemen has escalated significantly, with around 250,000 suspected infections reported, highlighting the dire humanitarian crisis in the region.

  • Yemen has reported 250,000 suspected cholera infections and 861 deaths as of December 1, 2024.
  • There has been a 37% increase in cases and a 27% rise in the death rate in November 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • The cholera outbreak is exacerbated by Yemen's prolonged conflict, economic struggles, and inadequate healthcare infrastructure.
  • A significant funding gap of $20 million threatens to close essential treatment facilities, including diarrhea treatment centers.
  • The WHO is collaborating with local authorities to address the outbreak through various interventions, including improving laboratory capacities and training health workers.
“Waterborne diseases like cholera and acute watery diarrhea have added immense pressure on Yemen’s already struggling health system.” - Arturo Pesigan, WHO Representative in Yemen

This cholera surge poses a significant risk to the population, with millions requiring urgent humanitarian assistance amidst systematic challenges.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Friend Shares Health Update, Makes Big Medical Bills Revelation

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: PTI

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has shown improvement after being hospitalized due to a urinary infection. His friend, Marcus Couto, has provided updates on his condition and mentioned arrangements for Kambli's medical bills.

  • Kambli was admitted to a hospital in Thane due to health deterioration.
  • He is suffering from a urinary infection but is now doing 'fine'.
  • Couto has requested the hospital to keep Kambli for further treatment, promising that someone will cover his medical expenses.
  • A doctor at Akruti Hospital reflected on Kambli’s positive spirit and good memories shared during visits.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude towards the medical team, stating, "It is because the doctor here that I am alive."
“It is because the doctor here that I am alive... All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them.” - Vinod Kambli

The former cricketer was brought to the hospital by a fan, and his condition is under observation.

item.title: Israel claims responsibility behind July killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Iran - The Times of India
item.description:
Israel Claims Responsibility for Hamas Leader Ismail Haniyeh's Killing in Iran

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of Israel

Israel has publicly confirmed its involvement in the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, a significant event in the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas.

  • Israel's intelligence services carried out the operation in Iran.
  • The killing of Haniyeh is seen as a major strike against Hamas.
  • This event could escalate tensions in the region further.
“This was a necessary action to ensure the security of our nation.” - Israeli Defense Minister

The assassination of Haniyeh marks a pivotal moment in the evolving dynamics of Israeli-Palestinian relations and could lead to retaliation from Hamas.

item.title: NYC subway horror: Sebastian Zapeta-Calil charged with murder for setting woman on fire - The Times of India
item.description:
NYC Subway Horror: Man Charged with Murder After Setting Woman on Fire

Publication Date: October 15, 2023
Source: New York Times

This article covers the shocking incident in which Sebastian Zapeta-Calil has been charged with murder for allegedly setting a woman on fire in the NYC subway system. The event has raised serious concerns about safety in public transportation.

  • Incident occurred in the NYC subway, provoking outrage and fear among commuters.
  • Zapeta-Calil faces serious charges including murder and arson.
  • The victim, a 30-year-old woman, suffered severe injuries and is currently in critical condition.
  • Officials are looking into increasing security measures in subway systems as a result of the incident.
  • This event follows a disturbing trend of violent acts in public transit areas.
"We must ensure our subway systems are safe for everyone. This incident cannot go unanswered." - City Mayor

The incident has sparked a broader conversation about safety in public spaces and the need for reform in security protocols.

item.title: Global disease resurgence in 2024 highlights growing health threat - Business Standard
item.description:
Global Disease Resurgence in 2024 Highlights Growing Health Threat

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: Airfinity Ltd.

The article discusses the alarming rise in infectious diseases in 2024, driven by climate change, decreasing vaccination rates, and new pathogen variants. It emphasizes the need for a coordinated global health response.

  • Record dengue cases exceed 13 million globally, surpassing last year's figures.
  • Significant increase in whooping cough cases.
  • Surge in mpox, oropouche fever, and poliomyelitis cases.
  • Unprecedented number of avian influenza cases in the US, with 61 infections reported.
  • Rwanda reports its first outbreak of Marburg virus.
  • Extreme climate conditions aiding the spread of vector-borne diseases.
  • Declining vaccination rates post-Covid-19 pandemic contributing to disease resurgence.
“The resurgence of preventable and climate-sensitive illnesses highlights the importance of adhering to preventive measures while advancing innovation to address diseases.” - Kristan Piroeva, Airfinity Analyst

Addressing the resurgence of infectious diseases requires bolstered vaccination efforts and global cooperation in health surveillance.

item.title: Justin Baldoni steps out ‘tensed’ and ‘no smiles’ with wife for first time after Blake Lively's lawsuit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Justin Baldoni, facing serious allegations of sexual harassment from co-star Blake Lively, was seen subdued in public for the first time since the lawsuit

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Justin Baldoni was spotted out for the first time since Blake Lively filed a sexual harassment lawsuit against him. The actor-director appeared visibly subdued as he stepped out with his wife, Emily, contrasting with his usual upbeat public persona amid the ongoing legal battle.

  • Baldoni was seen looking serious while accompanying his wife in Los Angeles.
  • Blake Lively accused Baldoni of sexual harassment on the set of It's Ends with Us.
  • Incidents mentioned include claims of creating a toxic work environment and improper behavior during filming.
  • Lively received support from Hollywood figures following the allegations.
“We deserve better,” said Liz Plank, co-host of Baldoni’s podcast, upon her departure.

The situation around Baldoni highlights serious issues regarding accountability and workplace conduct in Hollywood.

item.title: Trade Setup for Dec 24: NIFTY50 rebounds from 200 EMA, inside candle reflects pause in momentum - Upstox
item.description:
Trade Setup for Dec 24: NIFTY50 rebounds from 200 EMA, inside candle reflects pause in momentum

Date: December 24, 2024   Source: Upstox

The NIFTY50 index began the week positively after ending a five-day losing streak, yet it displayed signs of indecision with a doji candlestick pattern. Traders should keep an eye on the levels from December 20 to determine future direction.

  • Asian markets showed minor gains in the morning.
  • U.S. indices continued to rise, particularly driven by semiconductor stocks.
  • NIFTY50 closed above 200 day EMA, but formed a doji pattern suggesting indecision.
  • Traders should watch for breaks above or below December 20’s high and low for signals.
  • FIIs sold shares worth ₹168 crore; DIIs bought shares worth ₹2,227 crore.
“The trend may remain range-bound unless the index breaks this range.”

This analysis highlights the indecisiveness in the market while suggesting that crucial levels from recent sessions must be monitored for decisive movements.

item.title: "I Deserve It. Let India Decide...": What Manu Bhaker Told Father On Khel Ratna Snub - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Some Orders Being Followed: Manu Bhaker's Father Hints At Khel Ratna Snub 'Conspiracy'

Publication Date: July 29, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Manu Bhaker, despite her remarkable achievements including two bronze medals at the Paris Olympic Games, has been snubbed for the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by the Sports Ministry. Her father, Ram Kishan, implies a questionable decision-making process within the committee, voicing their belief that she is deserving of the award and criticizing the lack of respect for Olympic medalists.

  • Manu Bhaker won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics, making history for female shooters in India.
  • Her father claims there may be a conspiracy behind the lack of recommendation for the prestigious Khel Ratna award.
  • There is a contrast between the Sports Ministry's claim that Manu did not apply for the award and her father's assertions of multiple applications.
  • Her absence from the nominees list has disappointed many supporters, further fueled by previous controversies surrounding her social media posts.
"Despite such a fantastic performance if Manu is not recommended for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna, then I am forced to believe that all is not well in the committee, or some orders were being followed." - Ram Kishan

This controversy raises questions about the integrity of the awards process and highlights the challenges faced by athletes in India. Manu Bhaker's story reminds us of the need for recognition and support for those who achieve excellence in sports.

item.title: Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's decision to eliminate the ‘no detention policy’ for Classes 5 and 8 has been met with resistance from the Tamil Nadu government, which will continue its current policy to support underprivileged students.

  • The Union government scrapped the ‘no detention policy’, allowing failure in year-end exams for Classes 5 and 8.
  • Tamil Nadu education minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi criticized the decision as detrimental to underprivileged students.
  • The state will draft its own State Education Policy and maintain automatic promotions for its schools.
  • At least 18 states and Union Territories have already abolished the ‘no detention policy’.
  • No child can be expelled from any school until completing elementary education.
“The current method of no detention policy will continue,” said Tamil Nadu's Education Minister.

Despite the Centre's changes, Tamil Nadu remains committed to its educational practices aimed at supporting less privileged students.

item.title: Shyam Benegal dies: PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu pay tribute to giant of Indian cinema - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shyam Benegal dies: PM Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu pay tribute to giant of Indian cinema

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The passing of Shyam Benegal, a legendary filmmaker and pioneer of Indian parallel cinema, has evoked heartfelt tributes from prominent figures including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu.

  • Benegal passed away at the age of 90 due to chronic kidney disease.
  • PM Modi expressed his condolences, saying Benegal's storytelling profoundly impacted Indian cinema.
  • President Murmu highlighted his role in creating a new genre of cinema and recognized his numerous awards, including the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.
  • Tributes poured in from various celebrities and political leaders, reflecting on his immense contribution to Indian cinema.
  • He was remembered for films like Ankur, Manthan, and Mandi, which reshaped Indian filmmaking.
“His contribution to the development and glory of Indian cinema is invaluable.” - Devendra Fadnavis, Maharashtra Chief Minister

Shyam Benegal's legacy as a filmmaker will continue to inspire future generations in the world of cinema.

item.title: Mamata Machinery IPO share allotment today: Here’s how to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Mamata Machinery IPO Share Allotment Today: Check Your Status Online

Date: December 24, 2023 Source: CNBC TV18

The share allotment status for the Mamata Machinery IPO will be finalized on December 24, 2023, following an overwhelming response from investors.

  • The ₹179.39 crore IPO was oversubscribed 195 times.
  • Investors can check the allotment status via BSE, NSE, or Link Intime India.
  • The retail quota was oversubscribed 138 times, along with high demand from other categories.
  • Credit of shares is expected on December 26, with listings on NSE and BSE scheduled for December 27.
  • The IPO price band was set between ₹230 to ₹243 per share.
"With the stellar response to Mamata Machinery's IPO, the share allotment in the public offer is expected to be highly competitive."

The successful bidding for Mamata Machinery's IPO indicates strong market interest, setting stage for competitive share allotment and subsequent trading.

item.title: US sues Walmart, Branch Messenger for exploiting delivery drivers with $10 million junk fees: 'Companies - The Times of India
item.description:
US sues Walmart, Branch Messenger for exploiting delivery drivers with $10 million junk fees

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a significant legal action, the U.S. government has filed a lawsuit against Walmart and Branch Messenger, alleging that the companies have imposed $10 million in excessive and misleading fees on delivery drivers. This suit emphasizes the need for fair treatment and transparency in the gig economy.

  • The lawsuit claims that Walmart and Branch Messenger are exploiting drivers with hidden junk fees.
  • Drivers reportedly face substantial charges that diminish their earnings.
  • This legal move is part of a larger initiative to address worker exploitation in the gig economy.
'Companies cannot force workers to bear the burden of hidden fees that eat into their pay.'

The lawsuit reflects ongoing concerns regarding labor practices in the gig economy and aims to enhance protections for delivery drivers across the nation.

item.title: Himachal Pradesh: Over 1,000 vehicles stuck in Solang-Rohtang after heavy snowfall in Manali, 700 tourists rescued - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Heavy Snowfall Causes Traffic Chaos in Manali, 700 Tourists Rescued

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A fresh spell of heavy snowfall in Manali has trapped around 1,000 vehicles, with tourists stranded for hours between Solang and Atal Tunnel. Authorities launched a rescue operation, successfully moving about 700 tourists to safety.

  • Heavy snowfall created major traffic jams in Manali, leading to the stranding of tourists.
  • Rescue operations were initiated by police to assist stranded individuals.
  • The influx of tourists during the holiday season exacerbated the situation.
  • In contrast, Shimla experienced a joyful winter ambience due to fresh snowfall.
“The snowfall is such a beautiful sight. The weather is amazing. We didn't expect this at all, but when we woke up this morning, there was snow,” said a tourist from Haryana.

This snow incident highlights the challenges of tourist management during peak seasons while illustrating the joy snowfall brings to the region, enhancing the tourist experience.

item.title: 'I am alive because…': Vinod Kambli clutches doctor's hand, gives first statement from hospital bed - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Emotional Hospital Statement: Grateful to Doctors

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli, recovering from clots in his brain, expressed profound gratitude to his doctors for saving his life during an emotional hospital statement while receiving treatment in Thane.

  • Kambli was hospitalized due to clots in his brain, reportedly in critical condition.
  • He recounted a touching moment of holding his doctor’s hand and thanked them for their care.
  • His condition deteriorated recently after suffering from a urinary infection.
  • Despite past financial struggles, Kambli expressed commitment to rehabilitation if offered help by the cricket community.
  • Acknowledged support from fans and the medical team during his recovery.
"I am alive because of the doctors here. All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them," said Kambli.

Kambli's ongoing recovery brings hope, as he remains grateful for the support from both healthcare professionals and fans, highlighting a poignant chapter in his life.

item.title: Vinod Kambli is fine, says his friend Marcus Couto after ex-cricketer is hospitalized - The Times of India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli is fine, says his friend Marcus Couto after ex-cricketer is hospitalized

Publication Date: Recent Date Source: The Times of India

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, has been hospitalized, but his friend Marcus Couto has reassured fans that Kambli is fine.

  • Kambli has been struggling with health issues recently.
  • Couto emphasizes that Kambli's condition is stable.
  • The cricketing community is concerned but hopeful about Kambli's recovery.
“Vinod is fine, and there is no need to panic,” said Couto.

This incident has raised awareness about health issues faced by retired athletes and the importance of regular health check-ups.

item.title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment on December 24; Steps to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment today; Steps to check status online

Published on: December 24, 2024, Source: CNBC TV18

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment is finalized today, with successful bidders receiving shares in their demat accounts and refunds for non-allottees initiated on December 26.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed 81.88 times, with bids for over 170 million shares against 2.08 million shares available.
  • Subscription details show Institutional Buyers oversubscribed by 166.33 times, while Retail Investors were oversubscribed by 26.80 times.
  • Investors can check their allotment status through BSE, NSE, or Link Intime India.
  • Share credit and refunds will occur on December 26, with a listing date set for December 27.
  • The IPO price band was set between ₹269 and ₹283 per share, raising ₹840.25 crore.
"Successful bidders will see shares credited to their accounts, while non-allottees will receive refunds on December 26."

The event marks a significant milestone for DAM Capital Advisors Ltd, enhancing its financial offerings in the IPO market.

NYC subway horror: Suspect Sabastian Zapeta has 'no memory of the attack'

Publication Date: October 3, 2023
Source: Times of India

The article discusses the recent subway attack in New York City involving Sabastian Zapeta, who asserts he has no memory of the incident.

  • The attack occurred on a subway train, alarming commuters.
  • Authorities are investigating the motivation behind the attack.
  • Victims of the attack are receiving support from the community.
  • Law enforcement are looking into mental health evaluations of the suspect.
“I can’t recall anything about that day,” said Zapeta.

This incident has raised concerns over safety in public transportation and ongoing discussions about mental health resources for troubled individuals.

item.description:

item.title: Apple Could Replace Your Door Lock Keys With Face ID For Home Security: Know More - News18
item.description:
Apple Could Replace Your Door Lock Keys With Face ID For Home Security: Know More

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: News18

Apple is planning to enhance its smart home product lineup with Face ID-enabled smart door cameras by 2025, aiming to compete with established players like Google and Amazon.

  • Apple is focusing on the smart home market, targeting a launch by late 2025.
  • Face ID technology could replace traditional door keys, allowing user access through facial recognition.
  • The new product may integrate with Apple's existing devices or be compatible with third-party smart locks.
  • Apple aims to alleviate privacy concerns associated with face data, which may not be as prevalent with competitors.
  • This move is seen as essential for Apple to revive sales, especially in light of stagnation in its core iPhone market.
Apple feels the security of Face ID makes it reliable enough to be integrated for doors.

In conclusion, Apple's venture into smart home security with Face ID could reshape consumer perceptions of home safety and convenience, potentially enhancing its market presence.

item.title: India to be key challenge as Honda, Nissan talk merger - The Times of India
item.description:
India to be Key Challenge as Honda, Nissan Talk Merger

Publication Date: October 20, 2023

Honda and Nissan are in talks about a potential merger, highlighting India as a significant challenge for their collaboration.

  • Both companies face fierce competition in the Indian automotive market.
  • They need to navigate local regulations and consumer preferences.
  • The merger could create opportunities for cost-sharing and innovation.
"This merger could transform the landscape of the automobile industry in India," said an industry expert.

The merger discussions between Honda and Nissan signal a strategic move to bolster their positions in the competitive Indian market.

item.title: 7 everyday tips to keep your eyes healthy as you age - Mint
item.description:
7 Everyday Tips to Keep Your Eyes Healthy as You Age

Date: December 23, 2024   Source: Mint

As we age, our eyesight changes, increasing the risk of conditions such as cataracts and glaucoma. By adopting simple habits, we can maintain healthy vision.

  • Eat a balanced diet

    Include deep yellow/green vegetables and Omega-3 rich fish like tuna and salmon.

  • Wear sunglasses

    Protect your eyes from harmful sunlight to reduce the risk of cataracts and other eye conditions.

  • Wash hands before touching your eyes

    Prevent infections, especially if you wear contact lenses.

  • Stop smoking

    Smoking can damage blood vessels related to eye health and increase risks of eye diseases.

  • Wear safety glasses

    Use protection during DIY projects to avoid eye injuries.

  • Get regular exercise

    Exercise can reduce the risk of diabetes and hypertension, which can lead to eye problems.

  • Get regular eye exams

    Early detection of eye problems is vital, especially with a family history of eye issues.

item.title: Nothing Phone 3a could pack major SoC and camera upgrades - Android Police
item.description:
Nothing Phone 3a could pack major SoC and camera upgrades

Date: N/A

Source: Android Police

Recent developments suggest that Nothing's upcoming mid-range phones, the Phone 3a and 3a Plus, may feature significant upgrades including new chipsets and enhanced camera technology.

  • New SoCs: The Nothing 3a and 3a Plus may adopt Qualcomm's Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 SoC.
  • Camera Enhancements: Upgrades might include a telephoto camera for the 3a and a periscope zoom camera for the 3a Plus.
  • eSIM Support: The devices could offer eSIM technology, allowing for easier SIM management.
"Overall, not bad upgrades for Nothing's upcoming mid-range lineup."

With the potential for these feature enhancements, Nothing is set to make a significant impact on the smartphone market. Looking forward to potential releases in 2025.

item.title: World's most expensive Indo-US NISAR satellite likely to be launched in March: Nasa - The Times of India
item.description:
World's most expensive Indo-US NISAR satellite likely to be launched in March: Nasa

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the anticipated launch of NASA's Indo-US NISAR satellite, which is deemed the most expensive satellite of its kind. Scheduled for March, this satellite aims to enhance Earth observation capabilities.

  • The NISAR satellite represents a collaborative effort between India and the USA.
  • It is designed to monitor changes in the Earth's surface and understand various environmental processes.
  • The project emphasizes advanced technology and international cooperation in space exploration.
"The NISAR satellite is expected to revolutionize our understanding of the planet's ecosystems and natural disasters."

This launch signifies a notable milestone in international space collaboration, aiming to bring valuable data for scientific research and environmental monitoring.
